title: 110_s2519
content: The "Contracting and Tax Accountability Act of 2007" prohibits the awarding of government contracts or grants to individuals or companies with seriously delinquent Federal tax debts. Section 3720B of title 31, United States Code, is amended to propose debarment from federal contracts for individuals with seriously delinquent tax debts, requiring certification of tax debt status for contract bids. The Secretary of the Treasury can disclose information to agencies about individuals with seriously delinquent tax debts. A standard form will be developed for certification and authorization. Revised regulations must be issued within 270 days. The term 'contract' is defined as a binding agreement for obtaining property or services. The term 'person' includes individuals, partnerships, and corporations with seriously delinquent tax debts. A partnership or corporation is considered to have a seriously delinquent tax debt if a partner or shareholder, respectively, meets certain criteria. A seriously delinquent tax debt is defined as an outstanding debt under the Internal Revenue Code for which a notice of lien has been filed in public records. It does not include debts being paid timely under an agreement or debts with a collection due process hearing. A seriously delinquent tax debt is defined as an outstanding debt under the Internal Revenue Code for which a notice of lien has been filed in public records. It does not include debts being paid timely under an agreement or debts with a collection due process hearing. Relief under section 6330 or section 6015 may be requested or pending. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION ON AWARDING OF GRANTS TO DELINQUENT FEDERAL DEBTORS. The head of any Executive agency offering grants over a certain threshold must ensure applicants do not have a seriously delinquent tax debt. A standard form for certification and authorization will be provided by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must revise regulations within 270 days to include the requirements of this section. Definitions state that a "person" includes individuals, partnerships, and corporations with seriously delinquent tax debts. The term "seriously delinquent tax debt" applies to individuals, partnerships, and corporations with such debts. A corporation is considered to have a seriously delinquent tax debt if an officer or shareholder with a significant stake in the company also has such a debt. The term "seriously delinquent tax debt" refers to outstanding debts under the Internal Revenue Code for which a notice of lien has been filed in public records. Exceptions include debts being paid timely under an agreement or those undergoing a collection due process hearing or relief request.
